title: 2017–18 Ukrainian Cup
text:
The 2017–18 <a href="Ukrainian%20Cup">Ukrainian Cup</a> was the 27th annual season of <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>'s <a href="Association%20football">football</a> knockout competition. The competition was planned to be started on 9 July 2017 and concluded on 9 May 2018.
This season the competition's administration was passed on to the <a href="Football%20Federation%20of%20Ukraine">Football Federation of Ukraine</a> that previously was conducted by both the Premier League and Professional Football League. The number of participants has increased to 52 and is the biggest in the last five years. The FFU also promised to introduce a system of bonuses for this season's competition, yet did not disclosed them.
All competition rounds consisted of a single game with a home field advantage granted to a team from lower league. Qualification for the competition is granted to all professional clubs and finalists of the <a href="Ukrainian%20Amateur%20Cup">Ukrainian Amateur Cup</a> as long as those clubs will be able to pass the season's attestation (licensing).
<a href="FC%20Shakhtar%20Donetsk">FC Shakhtar Donetsk</a> was the defending winner for the last two seasons. The Donetsk club has reached the competition finals in the last seven years winning five of them. There were around 300 clubs over the history of competition and it is a debut season for seven of them, Dnipro-1, Ahrobiznes, Metalist 1925, Polissya, Tavriya Simferopol, Sudnobudivnyk, and Prykarpattia. Both qualified amateur clubs have already participated in the competition before. It should be mentioned that only 10 clubs participated in every season of the tournament.
Competition schedule.
First Preliminary round (1/64).
In this round entered three representatives from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20First%20League">First League</a>, 21 clubs from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20Second%20League">Second League</a>, two representatives from the <a href="2016-17%20Ukrainian%20Amateur%20Cup">Amateur Cup</a>. The draw for this round that took place 30 June 2017 at the <a href="House%20of%20Football%20%28Kiev%29">House of Football in Kiev</a> was announced on 27 June 2017. The round matches were played on 9 July 2017. The archive of <a href="Ukrainian%20Association%20of%20Football">Ukrainian Association of Football</a> "Footpass" shows the Premier League club NK Veres Rivne playing at the first preliminary round instead of FC Lviv (please, see <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Ukrainian%20Premier%20League%23Shuffled%20teams">Veres – Lviv swap</a>). The clubs' "swap" occurred only next season, while the archive has been updated to show something that is completely wrong.
Notes:
Second Preliminary round (1/32).
In this round will include 15 more representatives from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20First%20League">First League</a> in addition to the two that advanced from the previous round as well as 10 clubs from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20Second%20League">Second League</a> and one representatives from the <a href="2016-17%20Ukrainian%20Amateur%20Cup">Amateur Cup</a>. The draw for this round that took place on 13 July 2017 at the <a href="House%20of%20Football%20%28Kiev%29">House of Football in Kiev</a> was announced on 11 July 2017. The round matches will be played on 26 July 2017, while the game between Tavriya and Nyva-V might take place later as Tavriya shares home stadium with Enerhiya Nova Kakhovka. Later (21 July 2017) it was confirmed that the date for the game Tavriya – Nyva-V is 27 July 2017.
Third Preliminary round (1/16).
In this round the first 6 representatives from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Premier League</a> will enter the competition along with the 14 teams that advanced from the previous round including 8 clubs from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20First%20League">First League</a>, 5 clubs from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20Second%20League">Second League</a>, and one representatives from the <a href="2016-17%20Ukrainian%20Amateur%20Cup">Amateur Cup</a>. The draw for this round was held on 4 August 2017 at the <a href="House%20of%20Football%20%28Kiev%29">House of Football in Kiev</a> and was announced on 1 August 2017. The round matches were played on 20 September 2017.
Round of 16 (1/8).
In this round the final 6 representatives from the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Premier League</a> will enter the competition along with the 10 teams that advanced from the previous round including 4 teams from the Premier League, 2 teams from the First League and 4 teams from the Second League. The draw was without seeds and was held on 27 September 2017. The round matches were played on 25 October 2017. 
Quarterfinals (1/4).
In this round advanced 5 representatives from the Premier League, a team from the First League and 2 teams from the Second League. The draw was without seeds and was held on 31 October 2017 in the <a href="House%20of%20Football%20%28Kiev%29">House of Football</a>, <a href="Kiev">Kiev</a>. The round matches were played on 29 November 2017.
Semifinals (1/2).
In this round advanced 3 representatives from the Premier League and a team from the Second League. The draw was without seeds and was held on 2 March 2018. <a href="SC%20Dnipro-1">SC Dnipro-1</a> will play its semifinal game at home as being from the lowest league. The round matches are scheduled to be played on 18 April 2018.
Bracket.
The following is the bracket which the Ukrainian Cup resembled. Numbers in parentheses next to the match score represent the results of a <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a>.
